snippet.title: Double Dragon II Vs Nekketsu Kōha Kunio-kun Bangai Ranto Hen Game Boy - USA Vs Japan | Nefarious Wes
snippet.description:
By now it’s common knowledge that America’s Renegade is a re-skinned version of Technos of Japan’s Nekketsu Koha Kunio-kun. So when Kunio-kun received a sequel on the Game Boy called: Nekketsu Koha Kunio-kun: Bangai Ranto Hen, it only made sense that it would also be the sequel to Renegade, simply titled: The Renegades. But Acclaim, the company who owned Double Dragon’s rights in the States, had different ideas, instead, retooling The Renegades to resemble a new Double Dragon game, with the idea that they would rake in more money by selling the portable brawler under a more recognizable franchise. But when it comes down to it, Double Dragon II on the Game Boy is a Kunio-kin game, and I’m here to look at all of the differences, and similarities, between the two different, yet very similar games.

0:00 Intro
1:08 Backstory
2:25 Game intro
4:21 Stage 1
8:43 Stage 2
11:24 Stage 3
12:49 Stage 4
14:40 Stage 5
16:42 Stages 6, 7 & 8
17:40 Stage 9
19:21 Stage 10
23:29 Outro

Check out Gaijillionaire’s channel, GTV: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCmpaIXvID-FsN5xsUNolYAw
Kunio-kun Fandom: https://kuniokun.fandom.com/wiki/Nekketsu_K%C5%8Dha_Kunio-kun:_Bangai_Rant%C5%8D_Hen
Double Dragon Fandom: https://doubledragon.fandom.com/wiki/Double_Dragon_II_(Game_Boy)
